Update to Activity Access as Remote-Learner and Meals for Remote Learners

For Remote Learners: We are establishing our support systems and we look to have our educational setting by September 8 to be consistent with MTDA. WE may have some staff begin earlier. If you need devices please email mbranger@huntley.k12.mt.us to set up a time and pickup location.

Activity Access-

If a student is a remote learner they CAN participate in our activities. This is a change to adjust to the needs of our students. Please contact Mr. Tim Bastian at tbastian@huntley.k12.mt.us if you have any questions.

Lunch-

Any remote learner that needs lunch, Monday through Thursday, should email Marlene Krum at mkrum@huntley.k12.mt.us to let her know you need lunch. The meal can be picked up from 11:00-11:15 at the JH door entrance.

We will have meals available for the student's normal standards in our school setting. This means if a student is free and reduced the meal is free or reduced but if they normally pay they would need to pay the normal fee for that meal. http://edne.tw/n659201

On the eve of the 2020 school year a quick pause to say THANK YOU to our staff as they have prepared to get to meet and greet our students. We ask for patience and courtesy towards all- students, fellow families, parents and our staff as we look forward to the 2020-2021 school year.

The excitement and nervousness is at an all time level as we get to see students on campus. We know there will be hurdles, there will be anxiousness and there will be adjustments as we continue this year.

We would not be ready to start up with students on campus if it was not for each employee of Huntley Project doing his/her part.

The online students will begin in early September and we will begin to get items out to our online students soon.

There are more emails and calls to be made and we will continue to contact those individuals. Please call or email the person you are wanting to visit with.

We will do our best to communicate changes as they happen and to strive for an above standard cleaning status in our school system.

Go Big Red!

For concerned individuals, we have no confirmed cases of the Coronavirus in Montana. If you have concerns about your student we encourage all families to respond by utilizing your primary care physician. We encourage families to keep students who are ill at home for 24 hours, or more, if needed.

This flyer helps to highlight the protective behaviors people can use in response to all viruses. We continue to encourage these protective behaviors with our students and staff.
